website_summaries.verdict: The good-looking D-Link HD Media Router 1000 DIR-657 is a very good router, though it doesn't offer much over the company's previous model, the DIR-655.
pros: The D-Link HD Media Router 1000 DIR-657 offers good throughput performance, stable wireless signal, and an Internet-based Parental Control feature
The router incorporates a SD card slot, has an intuitive and responsive Web interface, and supports IPv6, Gigabit Ethernet, guest networking, and an extensive set of networking features
cons: The DIR-657 doesn't feature dual-band and has a short wireless range

customer_reviews.title: Disadvantage of the product Dir-657 HD
customer_reviews.text: There are some disadvantage and I would like to highlight that rather the advantage of this product, because D-link is the master in that area and to improve. After struggling with the product I was able to findout the firmware update from the D-link blog, but it can be solved. But there are some main disadvantage is iI am not able to pair the Amazon fire stick and google chrome cast devices. But the cisco router can do that. I am not able to significantly fidout the HD stream engine feature of the product. Might be demonstrated well can be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Manickavel G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice router.
customer_reviews.text: I had a little trouble configuring the router with the driver CD, but after installing quite a few routers and modems in the past, I realized that the driver CD rarely works for any model. I called Tech Support and the router was up and running in 5 minutes. I use this router for a medium size home with less than 4 devices connected. It works very well to stream media and web surfing. Also it's design is pleasantly flat and simple, not towering with a mess of antennas sticking out. The extra features are good too, with usb, priority media streaming, and a nifty log in option.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the headaches for advanced setups
customer_reviews.text: It was a cheap gigabit router. Its wireless coverage can't cover my entire house reliably. It has issues working with ceton tuners over the network. It also had issued with Windows media center not being able to see extenders. I still use it for the internet connection but have a switch for tuners/extender and another router to handle wireless.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best encounters I've had in a customer service type scenario ...
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this item so I cannot comment yet on long term performance. Item arrived quickly, set up was a bit difficult. After a few attempts on our own with no success, I called technical support through D-Link and spoke to Jake, ID#AR004229, who walked me through the entire process and had the router up and running right away. One of the best encounters I've had in a customer service type scenario in a long time. If you find yourself having an issue with setup save yourself the headache and call technical support and they'll fix you right up.
customer_reviews.author: Katie O'Malley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great - much faster than old one. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: It does it job but there are not many configurable ...
customer_reviews.text: It does it job but there are not many configurable options. For example, I cannot get into bridge mode and sometimes my signal gets dropped or really slow. I'm not getting the gigabit speeds as I would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I bought this based on a review and recommendation from Cnet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on a review and recommendation from Cnet. It has performed very well thus far. The security is terrific as well.
customer_reviews.author: Marc J Gaudette

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep the wireless connection up without rebooting every so often
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one to replace the same that kept dropping the wireless connecting and had to be re-booted to bring it back. Guess what, this one does the same, waste of my money both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisandro E. Roque

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk. Constantly drops the WiFi signal, which is insanely frustrating when you're using Chromecasts throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyH

customer_reviews.title: It's okay. We have to keep restarting the router ...
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. We have to keep restarting the router every couple of days. Since we are in an apartment, it's only a room away, so it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: GauravS

customer_reviews.title: This is an awaful product from Dlink
customer_reviews.text: They should dump this product instead of selling as refurbished ! cheap shot from dlink it's quit working after 3 months ! wifi is a disaster ! it's in my garbage bin right now ! no further waste of time NEVER again of buying DLINK products and will tell anybody that I know to stay away from DLINK Products
customer_reviews.author: Joebob

customer_reviews.title: Not good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this through a deal of the day on eBay thinking I was getting a great deal, but I was wrong. The router would stop sending out a signal about three times a day and would have to be reset and occasionally I even had to setup the router all over again as if it was brand new despite not having done anything to it to make it wipe itself incredibly frustrating and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: nguyen linh

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice router,it does everything on the box, the only problem I had was the usb port would go out, but now that is fixed, I'm a happy camper again.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Smith

customer_reviews.title: Dir-657 Media Router
customer_reviews.text: This router appears to be strong and reaches throughout the house. Setup was relatively easy. Delivery was very quick. Excellent product. Excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: macsog60

customer_reviews.title: awesome router, it works excellent in all the house
customer_reviews.text: awesome router, it works excellent in all the house, the only problem its that sometimes i have to restart the router becauze i dosen't regonize the new IP number
customer_reviews.author: carlos

customer_reviews.title: d-link, great product!!
customer_reviews.text: C6493375, AR004213 Has trouble in the beginning cause the disc wouldnt set up, but talking to d-link customer service was great, no holding and walked right through to get my router hooked up, and the router works great, no problems. I would definitely recommend buying this, great product! Also cheap and you get more than what you paid for!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitsana Souriyaseng

customer_reviews.title: Drops connections several times a day
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine at first, then it started dropping the connections once a day, so I plugged it into a timer and rebooted it at night. Now it has to be rebooted 3 or 4 times a day. Can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Bad router... good customer service
customer_reviews.text: this router sucks. it always freaks out and we get "connection timeout" notices and sometimes we can find the network, but get no internet service. The customer service is good tho. When it breaks, you will at least be able to get your internet back in ~15 minutes. ref no. c6560336
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Bath

customer_reviews.title: Duh-Link
customer_reviews.text: worked 6 months, then starting intermittently dropping connection to my wireless devices. DLINK no help in resolving the problem, now I have a router that I can't return to Amazon and that DLINK won't support technically, so technically I don't have a router.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Thorough tech support!
customer_reviews.text: C6556512 Agent Reference ID: AR004211 Excellent assistance! Had to briefly hold but very helpful, stayed with me every step of the way and was very thorough and specific throughout the entire process. Have only used the router for the past 10 minutes, but I have been very thankful for their assistance through this process.
customer_reviews.author: ABeller

customer_reviews.title: Now that the firmware has been updated.
customer_reviews.text: Initially it was requiring rebooting at least once per day. We called in D-Link support, they walked us through the download/update, and as of this morning, no more rebooting it. Pretty sure we'll be keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: SHERMAN H WATTERS

customer_reviews.title: Good value and reliable functionality
customer_reviews.text: Much better than my old N router (ZyXEL NBG-416N). More stable and flexible with more options. Have not had to reboot since installation, unlike previous router.
customer_reviews.author: B Samson

customer_reviews.title: when it worked was pretty good, as well as speed
customer_reviews.text: Signal, when it worked was pretty good, as well as speed. I had dropped wifi connections, though, the whole time. Over 2-3 devices, I lost connection 3-5 times per week.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wireless router crashed continuously
customer_reviews.text: Installing the router was simple. However, the wireless capabilities crashed continuously. I have since packed it up and have put my old wireless router back into use. This was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Wong

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This product is no longer supported or warranties by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Nicely styled unit
customer_reviews.text: Nicely styled unit, Easy directions to install. I had a problem with the old modem I was using but the DLINK Tech Support walked me thru the setup. THANKS Case 6581356 Tech Specialist AR004233
customer_reviews.author: Steve Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Not Mac compatible
customer_reviews.text: I bought it, because it looks like a good router. Turns out it's not Mac compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Max Miller

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: I used belkin N750 before and buy dir-657 to replace the old router I thought it is better than my old one it is stable and fast and overall it is cheap
customer_reviews.author: joshlo

customer_reviews.title: Buy It
customer_reviews.text: Great product., also wonderful tech support with customer rep id # ar004212 and case # c6560607. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: steve crabtree

customer_reviews.title: good  not great
customer_reviews.text: Signal fades in and out and it really slows down with multiple users.
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I used this router several months but had trouble with the wifi signal dropping and having to restart the router at times more than once a day. I didn't know if it was my internet connection or the router. I switched routers and haven't had to restart it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Beth LC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: 500% better than my old router. youtube plays better without any hiccups.
customer_reviews.author: Hokming Cheung

customer_reviews.title: Two mistakes
customer_reviews.text: Mistake 1: Buying this router and Mistake 2: Throwing away the box it came in. After spending a couple of days trying to make this work equally as well as my last one, I give up. The voip goes out every few days and the wireless cameras don't work much better. Decided to donate this to a charity to write off some of the costs. Maybe someone else has time figuring out what's wrong. Just ordered a Linksys E4200 to replace it because I hear really good things about it.
customer_reviews.author: justGary

customer_reviews.title: D-LINK DIR-657 HD media router - failure
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for almost (2) months. Just this morning, I found that I could no longer get a signal unless seated in the same room as router. The signal strength seems to have dropped of significantly. The wireless signal will no longer penetrate walls. I've spent (2) hours on the phone with D-Link running repair routines. I have to call back a third time to see if I am approved for warranty replacement. The technicians were nice and helpfull but I can't possibly recommend a product that breaks down after less than (2) months. I am (3) weeks beyond Amazon's 1-month return period. Anyone out there have similar problems? Update to follow on replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hughes

customer_reviews.title: D-Link Router
customer_reviews.text: Not only has the router worked beautifully, the customer service department was so patient and helpful in helping me install it!
customer_reviews.author: Dirk T Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Performs horribly
customer_reviews.text: I've even tried advanced manual setup, all for naughtDLNA doesn't work at all - the router crashes as it tries to read the external HD. Weak signal. My 5y old lynksis wtr54g has better signal anywhere in the house. Upload and download speed are the same as the lynksis at 3ft. At 10 feet with a wall, the speed decreases so much that I can't watch youtube videos (not even a non HD vid). I'm very disapointed. As I'm not in the US and the return would cost too much, I'll only keep this in my drawer hoping for some open source firmware that makes it able to properly function.
customer_reviews.author: Romancini, Rubem

customer_reviews.title: Not entirely stable
customer_reviews.text: So far, the device drops all users between 24 and 36 hours after power on. Seems the firmware wasn't quite ready for primetime when they shipped.
customer_reviews.author: John Spear

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: This ubit was utter garbage. It would disconnect, exhibit poor coverage, awful GUI, etc. What a poor excuse for a router. It was returned immediately. To think I was giving D-Link a chance!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Ebi

customer_reviews.title: Died during setup
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this router (D-Link DIR-657)to replace a dead one-year-old D-Link DIR-855. This one made it to the last screen of the CD-based setup wizard,and then crapped out. Two hours of my time+45 minutes of Indian tech support, and this unit goes back for a refund. Next up: Netgear N750.
customer_reviews.author: alh

customer_reviews.title: D-Link is D-Good One
customer_reviews.text: This router performs very well for nearly all applications used by various members of the family. We've used other brands, too, but this one has performed more consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

product_meta.title: D-Link Systems HD Media Router 1000 (DIR-657)
product_meta.description:
The D-Link HD Media Router 1000(DIR-657) also comes equipped with 4 Gigabit ports to provide speeds up to 10x faster than standard 10/100 ports. What's more, it uses 802.11n technology with multiple intelligent antennas to maximize the speed and range of your wireless signal to significantly outperform 802.11g devices

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER



The HD Media Router 1000 has been designed to keep up with your connected lifestyle and deliver the uninterrupted connectivity you need to power multiple devices, simultaneously, and keep you in command of your digital universe. Up to 300 Mbps speed, four Gigabit Ethernet ports and HD Fuel bandwidth prioritization combine to optimize your online entertainment for seamless HD video streams, high-performance gaming, and VOIP calls without annoying glitches or lags. 



Get up to 300 Mbps data transfer rates and prioritize high-bandwidth applications with 
HD Fuel QoS (see larger image).



SD card slot for uploading HD media files.



See larger image.

D-Link's HD Media Routers are DLNA equipped, letting you connect to virtually any electronic device, automatically. SharePort Plus USB 2.0 lets you stream from any USB device--great for remote printing or connecting your NAS media servers. There's even an SD Card slot for accessing HD photos, videos and more. For complete home networking, Amplifi has you got you completely covered. 





WHAT YOU CAN DO WITH THE HD MEDIA ROUTER 1000
GIVE YOUR DIGITAL ENTERTAINMENT THE BANDWIDTH IT DESERVES. GIVE IT HD FUEL.
Watch Netflix play your Xbox 360 online or make Skype calls-- HD Fuel technology lets you do it all, all at once--free of the annoying lags or glitches you might experience with standard routers. HD Fuel automatically manages traffic flow, and optimizes your broadband connection to give to high-bandwidth applications like HD video streams and online gaming applications the highest priority. Stream multiple media content to multiple devices all at the same time--HD video, online gaming, large media file downloads--the HD Media Router 1000 delivers uninterrupted access to all your connected devices and keeps you in control of your digital entertainment.



NOW PLAYING: EVERYTHING.
HDTVs, the Boxee Box by D-Link, Blu-Ray Players, Playstation 3--the HD Media Router 1000 has been engineered to not only deliver seamless connectivity to your favorite Ethernet-enabled devices, but ANY device. Connect Printers, NAS servers--even security cameras--SharePort Plus USB 2.0 lets you stream from any USB device. There's even a SharePort App for Android and iPhone OS for online gaming support like Onlive. We've included an SD card slot for uploading HD media files like video and photo and with DLNA standard, the HD Media Router can connect to any device, automatically. 

ADVANCED HOME NETWORKING. SIMPLE SETUP
High-performance entertainment devices. Wireless signals anywhere in your home. Multiple laptops. Network storage systems. iPads, iPhones-- It used to be that designing a home network capable of handling so many devices required some serious hardware and some seriously messy installation. Not with Amplifi - the HD Media Router 1000 has not only been engineered with the power to handle all of your digital demands, but with the smarts to put it at the tip of your fingers. 

HD Media Routers offer Wireless G backwards compatibility and Wi-PnP technology for simple wireless connections through a USB drive. IPv6 allows for intelligent self-detect and router setup and with DLNA, the HD Media Router 1000 not only connects to any Ethernet-equipped device, but virtually any device, automatically. With push-button connectivity and 128-bit security encryption standard, a secure home network is as simple as plug and play. 



128-BIT SECURITY ENCRYPTION
The HD Media Router 1000 protects your network with 128-bit AES data security encryption--the same technology used in E-commerce or online banking. Create your own network name and password or put it at the tip of your fingers with Push Button Security standard on every Amplifi device. With hassle-free plug and play installation, and advanced Wi-Fi protected setup, the HD Media Router 1000 is not only one of the fastest routers available, it's also one of the safest.



GET READY FOR THE FUTURE: IPV6 EQUIPPED
With the growing number of Internet-enabled applications requiring IP addresses, the supply of IP addresses under the current Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) system has already been exhausted. The IPv6 protocol solves this network addressing exhaustion by creating more IP addresses, but migration from IPv4 to IPv6 is not necessarily automatic. No worries--this D-Link product is IPv6 Certified and ready for the future.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
HD Media Router 1000 (DIR-657); Ethernet cable; CD-ROM; power adapter; quick install guide

SPECIFICATIONS



See more
feature_bullets: SharePort Plus Technology for sharing USB 2.0
HD Fuel for Smooth Video Streaming and online gaming
